abstract: It’s undeniable that Wall Street has a public relations problem, as Goldman Sachs and others have learned all too well since the financial crisis. The New York Times’s Graham Bowley collects some pointers from experts in the spin game.
snippet: It’s undeniable that Wall Street has a public relations problem, as Goldman Sachs and others have learned all too well since the financial crisis. The New York Times’s Graham Bowley collects some pointers from experts in the spin game.
lead_paragraph: Lloyd C. Blankfein, chief executive of Goldman Sachs, the bank to bash on a resurgent Wall Street, is receiving a lot of advice lately, and it’s not just about money, The New York Times’s Graham Bowley writes in the Week in Review.

abstract: While Kraft Foods’ $16.7 billion offer for Cadbury is the only official bid so far, Hershey is considering one of at least $17 billion, while Nestle and Ferrero are weighing their options, The New York Times reported.
snippet: While Kraft Foods’ $16.7 billion offer for Cadbury is the only official bid so far, Hershey is considering one of at least $17 billion, while Nestle and Ferrero are weighing their options, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: The contest for Cadbury could become a little more crowded.

headline.main: Some Rivals Weigh Bids for Cadbury

abstract: Bank of America may extend its search for a new chief executive into next year if its board is unable to pick a candidate in the next four days, Bloomberg News reported.
snippet: Bank of America may extend its search for a new chief executive into next year if its board is unable to pick a candidate in the next four days, Bloomberg News reported.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America may extend its search for a new chief executive into next year if its board is unable to pick a candidate in the next four days, Bloomberg News reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: BofA May Extend C.E.O. Search into 2010, Report Says

abstract: Zili Shao, the head of the Asia practice at the law firm Linklaters and a major deal-maker, will lead the bank’s efforts in China.
snippet: Zili Shao, the head of the Asia practice at the law firm Linklaters and a major deal-maker, will lead the bank’s efforts in China.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase has hired Zili Shao, the head of the Asia practice at the law firm Linklaters and a major deal-maker, to lead its own efforts in China.

headline.main: JPMorgan Hires Lawyer as New China Head

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China

abstract: The CIT Group, a leading commercial lender, won bankruptcy court approval on Monday to borrow as much as $500 million to issue letters of credit that guarantee its debt.
snippet: The CIT Group, a leading commercial lender, won bankruptcy court approval on Monday to borrow as much as $500 million to issue letters of credit that guarantee its debt.
lead_paragraph: The CIT Group, a leading commercial lender, won bankruptcy court approval on Monday to borrow as much as $500 million to issue letters of credit that guarantee its debt.

headline.main: Judge Allows CIT to Borrow Up to $500 Million
